intro: Eleocharis testui, commonly known as the slender spike rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as pond margins and seasonally flooded areas. Its leaves are usually short and grass-like, and it produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis testui is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic habitats.
